channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A Healthy Lifestyle Can Add Years to Life, Despite 'Bad' Genes
item.description: Turn around those bad family genes with four lifestyle changes.

item.title: The Sound of Freedom
item.description: For a million years (more like 15,) I’ve been listening to a radio show: The Taylor Strecker Show. It’s a daily show that originated on SiriusXM and through a series of events became an independently broadcasted show on Patreon. There’s something interesting that happens when you listen to a daily show. You get to know... Read More

item.title: Plateauing At The Gym? Women Share What's Finally Helping To Tone Their Muscles*
item.description: Emphasis on tone (not bulk).

item.title: Mayo Clinic Minute: When to seek care for pelvic pain
item.description: Editor's note: May is National Women's Health Month Pelvic pain is common, affecting 15% of women of reproductive age. Pinpointing its cause, whether it's endometriosis, ovarian cysts or musculoskeletal issues, can be a challenge. Dr. Megan Wasson, a gynecologic surgeon who specializes in minimally invasive procedures at Mayo Clinic, says it's important to seek medical […] The post Mayo Clinic Minute: When to seek care for pelvic pain appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .

item.title: Taking Racism out of the Kidney Disease Equation
item.description: Kidney care in the U.S. is at a watershed moment of moving past a deeply entrenched, institutionally racist equation.

item.title: That Time I Went to the Eras Tour [Part Two]
item.description: To review part one of this adventure with Taylor Swift, click here. Click here to see all the Instagram highlight videos from Denver Night One. Mile High Stadium was pink and sparkly from head to toe. Never had I ever seen so many women in one place, nor so many generations piled into one venue. ... Read More

item.title: Melanoma in darker skin tones: Race and sex play a role, Mayo study finds
item.description: A recent Mayo Clinic study reveals melanoma is often detected later in people with darker skin complexions. The post Melanoma in darker skin tones: Race and sex play a role, Mayo study finds appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .

item.title: Plant-Powered Sleep: Vegan, Vegetarian Diets Unlock Extra ZZZs
item.description: Vegans and vegetarians sleep around 30 more minutes per night than average and up to 90% of them report good or excellent sleep quality, according to a new survey published by the Sleep Foundation.

item.title: That Time I Went to the Eras Tour [Part One]
item.description: Do you ever have one of those experiences where you want to remember exactly how you felt? That’s how I feel about my experience at the Taylor Swift concert this weekend. Correction: At the Eras Tour. Saying it was a concert does not feel like enough to justify the magnitude of the event. Let’s talk about the... Read More

item.title: A Cognition & Longevity Expert's Favorite Herb For Optimal Brain Health
item.description: One particular herb tops the list.

item.title: Mayo Clinic Minute: Treating breast cancer through surgery
item.description: Editor’s Note: May is National Women’s Health Month Globally, 2.3 million women are diagnosed with breast cancer every year, according to the World Health Organization. Advances in treating breast cancer are improving care and quality of life. Watch: The Mayo Clinic Minute Journalists: Broadcast-quality video (1:00) is in the downloads at the end of this […] The post Mayo Clinic Minute: Treating breast cancer through surgery appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .

item.title: Anorexia: The Body Neglected
item.description: What, exactly, does anorexia nervosa do inside the human body? The heart and bones suffer the most.

Knowing the Philadelphia Eagles were playing (and with no plans to watch the game), I let the City of Brotherly Love inspire this tasty dish. I used the Jenny Craig... Read More

item.title: This Nongreasy Sunscreen Balances Your Skin & Gives A Healthy Glow
item.description: For the perfect protective glow.

item.title: Mayo’s new ‘omics’ strategy leaps into the future
item.description: Imagine a future where healthcare is tailored precisely for you, right down to the molecules deep inside your cells. Targeted treatments and preventive strategies are customized to your genome. Your personal medical roadmap outlines hereditary genetic variants, provides guidance on environmental risks and offers strategies for maintaining heart health and preventing cancer, making it as […] The post Mayo’s new ‘omics’ strategy leaps into the future appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .

item.title: Postpartum PTSD: Right Diagnosis Can Help Mothers and Babies
item.description: Many new mothers aren’t aware that postpartum PTSD even exists, but it’s far from rare. Here's what to know.

item.title: My Headphones Were Constantly Falling Out During Long Runs, Until I Tried These
item.description: Finally, headphones that don't fall out when I sweat.

item.title: Mayo Clinic Minute: Melanoma misconception — dark skin tones at risk, too
item.description: The myth that people with dark skin are immune to melanoma, a type of skin cancer, has persisted for many years. It's a dangerous misconception that has caused some people not to be diligent about protecting themselves against dangerous ultraviolet (UV) rays. Dr. Dawn Davis, a Mayo Clinic dermatologist, says people with darker skin tones […] The post Mayo Clinic Minute: Melanoma misconception — dark skin tones at risk, too appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .
